document.docAuthor: Yamada, Mariana & De Moraes, Gilberto J.
document.docTitle: Protogamasellus pantanal Yamada & De Moraes 2020, n.sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A key to the species of Protogamasellus (Acari: Ascidae), with a new species from the Brazilian Pantanal

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A key to the species of Protogamasellus (Acari: Ascidae), with a new species from the Brazilian Pantanal

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Departamento de Entomologia e Acarologia, Escola Supeior de Agricultura “ Luiz de Queiroz ” (ESALQ) - Universidade de São Paulo (USP), 13418 - 900 Piracicaba, São Paulo, Brazil. marianayamada @ usp. br; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 6150 - 0397

Departamento de Entomologia e Acarologia, Escola Supeior de Agricultura “ Luiz de Queiroz ” (ESALQ) - Universidade de São Paulo (USP), 13418 - 900 Piracicaba, São Paulo, Brazil. marianayamada @ usp. br; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 6150 - 0397 & CNPq Researcher; Departamento de Entomologia e Acarologia, Escola Superior de Agricultura “ Luiz de Queiroz ” (ESALQ) - Universidade de São Paulo (USP), 13418 - 900 Piracicaba, São Paulo, Brazil.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Fixed cheliceral digit with 11–13 teeth and movable digit with three teeth. Epistome anteriorly rounded, with serrate margin. Podonotal shield with a continuous transverse line slightly posterior to z 6 and with 16 pairs of setae, setae j 2 inserted almost in a transverse line with the insertions of j 1 and z 1; unsclerotised cuticle next to podonotal shield with six pairs of setae ( s 1, s 2, r 2– r 5); with a pair of accessory plates anterolaterad of podonotal shield; opisthonotal shield with punctate depressions distributed, a continuous transverse line at the level of J 1 and 15 pairs of setae; with a pair of short transverse lines next to Z 1– S 1 and wavy lines between Z 3 and Z 5; unsclerotised cuticle next to opisthonotal shield with seven pairs of setae ( R 1– R 6 and UR ); ventrianal shield with two pairs of setae in addition to circumanals ( Jv 1, Jv 4, Jv 5 and Zv 1 on unsclerotised cuticle); peritreme short, extending anteriorly almost to the level of r 3.
Adult female ( Figs 1–6 ) Thirteen specimens measured.

Gnathosoma. Chelicera with antiaxial and dorsal poroids, and dorsal setae distinct; fixed cheliceral digit 27 (25–28) long, with 11–13 teeth and setiform pilus dentilis ; movable digit 26 (26–27) long, with three teeth ( Fig. 1 ). Epistome anteriorly rounded, with serrate margin (about 12 denticles) ( Fig. 2 ). Deutosternum with a smooth transverse line followed by six denticulate transverse lines, each with 6–8 denticles ( Fig. 3 ); corniculi spine-like, subparallel to each other. Seta h 3 in longitudinal line with h 1 and posteriad of h 2. Setal measurements: h 1 8 (7–9), h 2 5 (3–6), h 3 11 (10–14), pc 8 (7–10); setae aciculate and smooth.

Dorsal idiosoma ( Fig 4 ). Idiosoma 270 (257–280) long and 129 (125–133) wide at level of r 3. Podonotal shield smooth, except for a continuous transverse line slightly posterior to z 6; 124 (118–128) long and 105 (103–107) wide at level of s 3; with 16 pairs of setae, four pairs of poroids and a pair of solenostomes; setae j 2 inserted almost in transverse line with j 1 and z 1. Unsclerotised cuticle next to the podonotal shield with six pairs of setae ( s 1, s 2, r 2– r 5). With a pair of accessory sclerites fitting the anterolateral depressions of podonotal shield, between r 2 and z 1. Opisthonotal shield with a continuous transverse line at level of J 1, a pair of short transverse lines next to Z 1– S 1 and wavy lines between Z 3 and Z 5; with a series of punctate depressions distributed in the opisthonotal shield; 134 (128–140) long and 91 (89–94) wide at the level of S 3; with 15 pairs of setae, seven pairs of poroids and three pairs of solenostomes; solenostome between Z 3 and Z 4 large, solenostome between Z 2 and S 3 smaller, and solenostome close to S 5 inserted on a large sclerite. Unsclerotised cuticle next to the opisthonotal shield with seven pairs of setae (
R 1
–
R 6
, UR ); distinct Rp poroid between
R 3
and
R 4
. Setal measurements: j 1 24 (22–26), j 2 16 (14–17), j 3 21 (20–23), j 4 20 (16–23), j 5 18 (15–20), j 6 17 (16–19), J 1 26 (23–29), J 2 28 (23–30), J 3 31 (28–33), J 4 32 (30–35), J 5 16 (13–17), z 1 13 (9–16), z 2 20 (18–21), z 3 21 (15–24), z 4 23 (22–25), z 5 22 (21–24), z 6 23 (21–24), Z 1 24 (23–25), Z 2 26 (24–27), Z 3 26 (23–28), Z 4 29 (26–32), Z 5 35 (30–38), s 1 17 (14–23), s 2 14 (12–16), s 3 23 (20–24), s 4 23 (21–24), s 5 23 (21–24), s 6 22 (21–23), S 1 22 (21–24), S 2 23 (20–25), S 3 25 (22–26), S 4 26 (24–28), S 5 22 (20–23), r 2 21 (20–24), r 3 19 (11–21), r 4 12 (10–16), r 5 11 (9–12),
R 1
11 (9–13),
R 2
11 (10–14),
R 3
12 (10–15),
R 4
13 (11–16),
R 5
16 (11–17),
R 6
21 (17–24), UR 7 (9–5); setae aciculate and smooth.

Ventral idiosoma ( Fig. 5 ). Base of tritosternum 14 (13–16) long and 7 (6–9) wide proximally; laciniae 40 (38–42), separated for about 75% of their total length, pilose. Pre-sternal area slightly sclerotised, punctate and with scant, almost indistinguishable diagonal lines. Sternal shield smooth; anterior margin deeply emarginated, posterior margin concave; with a transverse bend anteriad of iv 1 less sclerotised than elsewhere; 72 (70–74) long and 65 (60–68) wide at the middle of coxae II; with three pairs of setae and three pairs of poroids; distances st 1– st 3 56 (55–59), st 2– st 2 43 (40–45). Metaesternal plates indistinguishable, fourth pair of sternal setae ( st 4) on unsclerotised cuticle. Genital shield bearing st 5; with a transverse line behind st 5 delimiting a more sclerotised posterior region; 52 (45–57) long and 28 (26–29) wide at widest level; distance st 5– st 5 24 (22–25); poroid iv 5 on unsclerotised cuticle, posterolaterad of st 5. With two pairs of metapodal plates, the anterior rounded and the posterior ellipsoidal. Unsclerotised opisthogastric cuticle with a sclerotised transverse line followed by three platelets between genital and ventrianal shield; with four pairs of setae ( Jv 1, Jv 4, Jv 5 and Zv 1), one pair of solenostomes and two pairs of poroids. Ventrianal shield with sparse lines, with anterior margin arched; 81 (75–90) long and 96 (90–100) wide at level of Jv 4; with two pairs of setae ( Jv 2– Jv 3) in addition to circumanals; para-anal seta inserted just anteriad of anterior margin of anal opening; post-anal setae outside the shield; with small anal opening, 15 (14–17) long. Anterior region of the endopodal plate fused with sternal shield; posterior region elongate, between coxae III and IV. Exopodal plate reduced to two subtriangular platelets between coxae II–III and III–IV. Setal measurements: st 1 16 (14–18), st 2 15 (13–16), st 3 16 (15–18), st 4 13 (12–14), st 5 10 (9–13), Jv 1 12 (10–13), Jv 2 15 (14–17), Jv 3 16 (14–19), Jv 4 8 (7–10), Jv 5 26 (24–30), Zv 1 10 (7–15), para-anal 20 (17–22), post-anal 36 (35–40); setae aciculate and smooth.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Protogamasellus pantanal
n . sp.
Female. 1. Chelicera; 2. Epistome; 3. Hypostome; 4. Tritosternum; 5. Dorsal view of idiosoma; 6. Ventral view of idiosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph: Peritreme and peritrematic plate. Peritreme short, extending anteriorly almost to the level of r 3; peritrematic plate virtually indistinguishable anteriad of stigma; behind each stigma, peritrematic plate continuing as a narrow strip with two poroids and a solenostome.

Legs. Lengths of legs (not including pretarsus): I: 253 (240–260); II: 174 (170–180); III: 156 (150–165); IV: 218 (210–230). Setation (legs I IV): coxae: 2 2 2 1; trochanters: 1 0/1 1/2 1; 1 0/1 0/2 1; 1 0/1 0/2 1; 1 0/1 0/2 1; femora: 2 3/1 2/2 2; 2 3/1 2/2 1; 1 2/1 1/0 1; 1 2/1 1/0 1; genua: 2 3/2 3/1 2; 2 3/1 2/1 2; 2 2/1 2/0 1; 2 2/1 3/0 0; tibiae: 2 3/2 3/1 2; 2 2/1 2/1 2; 2 1/1 2/1 1; 2 1/1 3/1 1; tarsi: I not counted 18 18 18. All legs with pretarsus containing claws and pulvillus.

Material examined.
Holotype female from pasture soil,
June 12, 2019
;
four paratype females from soil of natural vegetation of the Pantanal ,
September 12, 2018
;
one paratype female from soil of natural vegetation ,
March 12, 2019
;
two paratype females from soil of corn field ,
March 12, 2019
;
one paratype female from soil of corn field ,
June 12, 2019
;
four paratype females from soil of sorghum field ,
June 12, 2019
.

Etymology. The specific name
pantanal
refers to the biome from which the type specimens were collected.

Remarks. This species is most similar to
Protogamasellus massula ( Athias-Henriot, 1961 )
, described from Algeria , which also has long opisthonotal setae, a pair of UR setae, podonotal shield with setae j 2 about in transverse line with j 1 and z 1, and with interconnected wavy lines between Z 3 and Z 5. However,
P. massula
has: ventrianal shield longer than wide; at least J 4, Z 4, Z 5 and S 5 slightly serrate; two anteriormost opisthogastric setae of each side about in longitudinal line; distinct ornamentation of posterior section of opisthonotal shield (U-shaped line around J 4 connected at the base of each side to a diagonal line that reaches base of Z 4) and ventrianal shield (three lines parallel to margins anteriad of J 5 and other lines around anus). Differences between the new species here described and other species of
Protogamasellus
species can be seen in the dichotomous key subsequently provided in this publication.
